abstract: Ahead of next week’s shareholder meeting, Verizon Communications is dropping a policy that allows retired chiefs to use the corporate jet.
snippet: Ahead of next week’s shareholder meeting, Verizon Communications is dropping a policy that allows retired chiefs to use the corporate jet.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications, which reported first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, is set to hold its annual meeting next week. It will face several proposals from shareholders looking to change various things at the company, including so-called golden coffins, which typically provide hefty benefits for the family of an executive following that executive’s death.

headline.main: Free Ride Is Ending for Verizon’s Ex-Chiefs
